Activity: Log in to the system, check emails and company announcements. Skim through any relevant articles or discussions about resource management systems in third-person shooters to gather some ideas.

Initial brainstorming on the specifics of the resource system. Decide on which resources to implement first (health, stamina). Consider how these resources will affect combat and movement. Document initial ideas.

Start implementing the health resource. Define the data structure for health (e.g., current health, max health). Implement functions for increasing and decreasing health. Add unit tests for health functionality.
Integrate the health system with the combat system. Ensure that taking damage reduces health. Implement a death mechanism when health reaches zero. Add unit tests for damage calculation and death.
Continue integrating the health system with combat by adding more sophisticated damage calculation and perhaps even implementing some basic healing.
Review the implemented code. Refactor if necessary. Write more unit tests for different damage scenarios and edge cases.
Document the implemented health system. Push the changes to the remote repository.
